summary: Email chain between FBI personnel and a forensic accountant regarding the coordination of financial subpoena returns in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistics for receiving bank records, note that certain banks are represented by counsel, and reference an attached subpoena tracker.

persons.name: Ori
persons.context: Appears as the sender/author of multiple emails in the chain, coordinating the receipt of subpoenaed financial records and transmission methods.

persons.name: Forensic Accountant FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Sent the initial email with an attached summary of financial subpoenas served in the Epstein investigation.

connections.person2: Forensic Accountant FBI New York Field Office
connections.description: Coordinating on the logistics of receiving and transmitting subpoenaed financial records for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Coordination on Subpoena Returns
events.description: Email exchange regarding how to receive copies of approximately 20 subpoena returns from banks and the planned transmission of a 5 GB production of materials.
personsInvolved: Forensic Accountant FBI New York Field Office

events.title: Financial Subpoenas Served
events.description: A forensic accountant served financial subpoenas and provided a summary tracker to the FBI team.
personsInvolved: Forensic Accountant FBI New York Field Office

keyFacts: The FBI was actively serving financial subpoenas on banks as part of the Epstein investigation in October 2019.
Certain banks were represented by counsel, requiring coordination with attorneys rather than direct contact.
A significant volume of data (approximately 5 GB) was being compiled and transmitted between investigators.
The correspondence indicates a systematic, documented approach to tracking financial subpoena compliance.
